verbose_text: In peripheral tissues such as the liver, disruption of the core molecular clock does not necessarily result in arrhythmicity, with evidence of newly rhythmic genes emerging in the absence of Bmal1 [XREF_BIBR], but loss of BMAL1 in the liver reduced the amplitude of the oscillations, and was accompanied by changes in DNAse1 footprint patterns marking loss of BMAL1 : CLOCK heterodimer action [XREF_BIBR].
